meanings.definition: A polysaccharide found in brown algae.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study laminarin in brown algae.
meanings.sent3: Why did the brown algae invite the laminarin to the party? Because it was a carbohydrate bash!
meanings.sent4: The laminarin in brown algae is like a hidden treasure waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, laminarin looks like tiny sparkling jewels in brown algae.

meanings.definition: A type of storage carbohydrate in certain marine organisms.
meanings.sent1: Certain marine organisms store energy in laminarin.
meanings.sent2: Laminarin is an important energy source for some marine creatures.
meanings.sent3: Why did the marine organism keep laminarin in a safe? To protect its precious energy stash!
meanings.sent4: The laminarin in marine organisms is like a fuel reserve for long journeys.
meanings.sent5: In the ocean, laminarin acts as a power-packed snack for hungry marine organisms.
